episodeTitle: A Super Rookie! Bartolomeo the Cannibal!
description: The Block B battle begins at the Corrida Colosseum. Bartolomeo makes his debut, provoking the crowd by throwing a fake bomb. Cavendish explains his hatred of the Worst Generation while Bellamy defeats multiple opponents. Don Chinjao inadvertently reveals Luffy's true identity to Cavendish by asking about his grandfather Garp.

events.title: Bartolomeo's First Appearance
events.description: Bartolomeo the Cannibal makes his anime debut as he enters the Corrida Colosseum for the Block B battle. The crowd immediately begins heckling him, showing their hostility towards the notorious rookie pirate.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important characters in the Dressrosa arc and future Straw Hat Grand Fleet captain. Bartolomeo will prove to be a crucial ally to Luffy and eventually wins Block B.

events.title: Bartolomeo Throws Fake Bomb at Crowd
events.description: In response to the crowd's heckling, Bartolomeo throws what appears to be a bomb into the stands, causing mass panic. It turns out to be a fake, revealing Bartolomeo's cruel sense of humor and disregard for public opinion.
events.significance: Establishes Bartolomeo's character as someone who doesn't care what others think of him and enjoys antagonizing crowds. This trolling behavior becomes a defining characteristic.

quotes.text: You all seem to be having fun! Here's a present for you!
quotes.speaker: Bartolomeo
quotes.context: Before throwing the fake bomb into the crowd

events.title: Cavendish Reveals His Hatred of the Worst Generation
events.description: Cavendish explains to Luffy (disguised as Lucy) why he despises the Worst Generation supernovas. He reveals that when he became a pirate three years ago, he was famous and beloved, but the Battle of Marineford, the Eleven Supernovas, and the Blackbeard Pirates stole his fame and glory.
events.significance: Establishes Cavendish's motivation and creates dramatic irony since Luffy is one of the Worst Generation members Cavendish wants to kill. Also explains why new supernovas like Bartolomeo further anger him.

quotes.text: When I came to the New World about three years ago, I made a big name for myself. But my fame was overshadowed by the Battle of Marineford, the Eleven Supernovas, and the Blackbeard Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: Explaining his grudge against the Worst Generation to Lucy (Luffy)

quotes.text: I just want to kill them all!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: When Luffy suggests he should forgive them

events.title: Blue Gilly Debuts
events.description: Blue Gilly, a martial artist from the Longleg Tribe, makes his first appearance as one of the Block B competitors. He demonstrates his exceptional leg-based fighting style.
events.significance: Introduces Blue Gilly who will later become part of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet as a member of the Ideo Pirates. Shows diversity of competitors in the tournament.

events.title: Ricky (Riku Doldo III) Debuts in Disguise
events.description: A mysterious gladiator named Ricky appears in Block B, wearing armor and a helmet that conceals his identity. He is actually Riku Doldo III, the former king of Dressrosa, competing in disguise.
events.significance: The former king of Dressrosa enters the tournament, though his true identity remains hidden at this point. This is a critical plot element that will be revealed later and ties directly to Dressrosa's tragic history.

events.title: Tank Lepanto's Debut
events.description: Tank Lepanto, the defense captain of Dressrosa, makes his first appearance as a competitor in Block B. He reveals he has been coaxed into fighting for the Prodence Kingdom.
events.significance: Introduces another competitor and shows the complex political alliances forming in the tournament. Lepanto's willingness to fight for money over loyalty foreshadows Dressrosa's corruption.

quotes.text: Money is what makes the world go round! Dreams are unimportant because I prefer to collect the easiest money I can possibly acquire.
quotes.speaker: Tank Lepanto
quotes.context: When Bellamy mocks him for teaming up with others

events.title: Bellamy's Spring Death Knock
events.description: Bellamy demonstrates his improved techniques from his time in the New World, using Spring Death Knock to defeat multiple opponents quickly. He transforms his arm into a spring and releases it in a powerful long-distance punch.
events.significance: Shows Bellamy's growth since his humiliating defeat in Jaya. Demonstrates that he has become significantly stronger and is a serious contender in the tournament.

events.title: Block B Battle Royale Begins
events.description: The Block B battle officially begins at the Corrida Colosseum with multiple competitors fighting simultaneously for the chance to advance and win the Mera Mera no Mi. The battle features Bartolomeo, Bellamy, Cavendish (watching), Don Chinjao, Blue Gilly, Tank Lepanto, Ricky, Hack, Dagama, King Elizabello II, and many others.
events.significance: Marks the official start of Block B, one of the most important tournament blocks featuring several future allies and enemies. The winner of this block will play a crucial role in the arc's conclusion.

events.title: Dagama Forms Alliance to Protect King Elizabello II
events.description: Dagama, the tactician from the Prodence Kingdom, successfully forms an alliance with multiple Block B competitors including Tank Lepanto. Their goal is to protect King Elizabello II while he charges up his devastating King Punch technique, which requires one hour of preparation.
events.significance: Introduces the King Punch as a legendary technique and shows political maneuvering within the tournament. This alliance strategy becomes a major factor in how the Block B battle unfolds.

quotes.text: We must thin out the numbers and protect the king at all costs. His King Punch will decide this battle!
quotes.speaker: Dagama

events.title: Don Chinjao Reveals Luffy's True Identity to Cavendish
events.description: Don Chinjao approaches Luffy and Cavendish, immediately addressing Luffy as 'Straw Hat' and asking how his grandfather Garp is doing. This inadvertently reveals to Cavendish that Lucy is actually Monkey D. Luffy, one of the Worst Generation supernovas he despises. Chinjao also reveals his grudge against Garp and his intention to take it out on Luffy.
events.significance: A major turning point that creates tension between Luffy and Cavendish, and establishes Don Chinjao as a dangerous opponent with a personal vendetta. This revelation affects the dynamics between these characters for the rest of the arc.

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy! How is your grandfather Garp doing?
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao
quotes.context: Revealing Luffy's identity in front of Cavendish

quotes.text: A long time ago, Garp nearly killed me, and I have decided to hold a grudge against his descendants!
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao

events.title: Don Chinjao's Grudge Against Garp Explained
events.description: Don Chinjao explains that thirty years ago, he battled Vice Admiral Garp multiple times. Garp ultimately defeated him and flattened his drill-shaped head, which not only stripped him of his pride but also made him unable to access his treasure hidden beneath layers of ice. This devastating loss caused him to abandon piracy and bear a grudge against Garp's family.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory connecting the current generation to the previous era. Shows Garp's strength and establishes Don Chinjao as a legendary pirate from the old generation. The flattened head will become important later in the arc.

events.title: Hack's Debut
events.description: Hack, a Japanese soldierfish fish-man and member of the Revolutionary Army, makes his debut as a Block B competitor. He is known as 'Hundredth Dan' Hack and serves as a combat instructor for the Revolutionary Army.
events.significance: First appearance of a Revolutionary Army member in the tournament, connecting the Corrida Colosseum storyline to the broader Revolutionary Army subplot. Hack's presence hints at the Revolutionary Army's interest in Dressrosa.

quotes.text: When I came to the New World about three years ago, I made a big name for myself. But my fame was overshadowed by the Battle of Marineford, the Eleven Supernovas, and the Blackbeard Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Cavendish
quotes.context: Explaining his hatred of the Worst Generation

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy! How is your grandfather Garp doing?
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao

quotes.text: Money is what makes the world go round! Dreams are unimportant because I prefer to collect the easiest money I can possibly acquire.
quotes.speaker: Tank Lepanto
quotes.context: When confronted by Bellamy about his alliance

themes.description: Cavendish's obsession with fame and his resentment toward those who overshadowed him explores the theme of ego and the desire for recognition in the pirate world.
themes.symbolism: The Corrida Colosseum itself represents the stage where pirates compete for glory and recognition.

themes.description: Don Chinjao's grudge against Garp being directed at Luffy represents the burden of inherited conflict and how the sins of fathers are visited upon their children.
themes.symbolism: Chinjao's flattened head symbolizes old wounds that never heal and resentment passed down through generations.

themes.description: Multiple characters are in disguise (Luffy as Lucy, Riku as Ricky), and the revelation of true identities creates dramatic tension throughout the episode.
themes.symbolism: Masks and disguises represent the hidden truths beneath Dressrosa's cheerful surface.

characterSpotlights.development: Bartolomeo is introduced as a ruthless, crowd-hating rookie pirate with a notorious reputation. His trolling behavior and disregard for public opinion immediately establishes him as an unpredictable wild card in the tournament.
keyActions: Enters the Corrida Colosseum to jeers from the crowd
Establishes himself as one of Block B's most dangerous competitors
quotes: You all seem to be having fun! Here's a present for you!

characterSpotlights.development: Cavendish reveals his deep-seated hatred for the Worst Generation, creating dramatic tension as he unknowingly confides in Luffy, one of the very supernovas he wants to kill.
keyActions: Explains his grudge against the Worst Generation to Lucy
Shows his collection of knife-marked bounty posters
Learns Lucy's true identity as Luffy at episode's end
quotes: I just want to kill them all!

characterSpotlights.role: Plot catalyst and connection to past
characterSpotlights.development: Don Chinjao bridges the current era with the previous generation, revealing his history with Garp and establishing himself as a legendary warrior with unfinished business.
keyActions: Reveals Luffy's true identity to Cavendish
Declares his intention to take revenge on Garp's grandson
quotes: A long time ago, Garp nearly killed me, and I have decided to hold a grudge against his descendants!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes of the crowd's reaction to Bartolomeo and added more animation to the fake bomb panic scene.
Additional dialogue was added to Cavendish's explanation of his hatred for the Worst Generation to make his motivations clearer.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the anime debut of Bartolomeo, who will later become the captain of the second ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.
The episode corresponds to chapters 706 and 707 of the manga, with the anime adding extended scenes of the tournament atmosphere.
Episode 636 had a TV rating of 6.8% in Japan, ranking 6th in its timeslot when it originally aired.
Bartolomeo's epithet 'The Cannibal' comes from his mockery of rivals, not from actually eating people as the name might suggest.
